answerText: flux[10] After measuring the flux intensity of a star in an image, this type of calibration must be performed.  In general, this term refers to observations that integrate light flux over a wide range of wavelengths, as opposed to spectroscopic observations.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 12 | 18 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This quantity is equal to the luminosity of an object divided by four pi r squared. For 10 points each: [10] Name this quantity, the amount of energy received from a certain object per unit area per unit time.
